text:
According to this thread (<https://integrate.HubSpot.com/t/sslhandshakeexception-server-certificate-change-is-restricted-during-renegotiation/7379/7>) there was recently made a change that switched the certificate authority used for the SSL certificate at `<http://api.hubapi.com|api.hubapi.com>`. This caused all kinds of trouble for one of our clients, and I can see from the thread that they were not the only ones affected.

Was this change announced anywhere before it was made, and if so, where and how do we get notified about such changes in the future? :slightly_smiling_face:
i think you can use: `?hs_ungate__cos_renderer_combine_all_css=false` as a param at the end to see it when its not combined
On my end it's looking like the AdBlock CTA issue has been resolved.  Is this the same for everyone else?
Yep, should be resolved now, if people aren't seeing it resolved, they may need to right click the extension then go to options and update the lists.
Is there a reason that there are no more line duplicate or auto complete in the editor anymore?
keyboard shortcuts didn’t work in there when I was using, also, but may have been fixed now
I think HubSpot is using Code Mirror and all of those features exist for code mirror..
Hi guys – anyone know what CSS I'd apply to remove the actual radio circles, but maintain the same functionality? I'd like them work more like a button with hover states, etc...
This is what I'd like the form to eventually look like.

I've done something similar, if I recall correctly I had to hide the input itself with CSS, then style the label element instead. I believe if you click the label it will have the same function, but I'm not 100% sure.

I see, is there any way to style forms individually? Most of these changes are reflecting all forms throughout the site... I suppose placing the HubSpot `script` within its' own div with unique ID's may do it?
I'd just throw a parent class around it then scope your changes to within that parent. ie .sample-parent-class .hs-form .input {example: style;}
Is there something going on right now with blog topics going from /tag/ to /topic ?

Hey <@U2H1Q3F8R>. I believe it was around the time we released Content Strategy we also made that change in Blog from /topic to /tag. Given the terminology of "Topics" and "Topic Clusters" we didn't want there to be any confusion between the two. At the time we updated all of the documentation, and I believe we handled a redirect for anything that was pointing to /topic (which would then redirect to /tag...).
